jinngine.physics
Interface DeactivationPolicy

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultDeactivationPolicy
public interface DeactivationPolicy

A utility used by Scene to classify inactive and active bodies. Note that both functions may return false for the same body. This indicates that the current activation state for the body should not be changed, regardless of its current state. In general, the end-user should only care about this interface if one wants to implement a custom deactivation policy. Usually, the DefaultDeactivationPolicy will be adequate for most purposes.

Method Summary
 void activate(Body b)
          Activate the body b.
 void deactivate(Body b)
          Deactivate the body b.
 boolean shouldBeActivated(Body b)
          Returns true if Body b should be activated
 boolean shouldBeDeactivated(Body b)
          Returns true if the Body b should be put into an deactivated state
 

Method Detail

shouldBeDeactivated

boolean shouldBeDeactivated(Body b)
Returns true if the Body b should be put into an deactivated state

shouldBeActivated

boolean shouldBeActivated(Body b)
Returns true if Body b should be activated

deactivate

void deactivate(Body b)
Deactivate the body b. This method is called by the Scene, to deactivate a body, rather than having the Scene accessing the Body state directly. This allows for policies to store more data in relation to deactivation, to apply more advanced heuristics.

activate

void activate(Body b)
Activate the body b. See deactivation.
